definition: to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: The more atrocious your family's behavior is, the funnier it can be in the retelling.
sentences.chinese: 家人的行为越恶劣，在转述中就越滑稽。

sentences.english: This paper is mainly intended to take as its subject the cognitive_pragmatic features of language reports.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要以语言转述现象的认知语用特征为研究对象。

sentences.english: Mr. Qian relayed Shaolin Temple abbot Shi as saying.
sentences.chinese: 钱先生转述少林寺方丈释永信的话说。

sentences.english: These are for you to read and practice paraphrasing and referencing before you come to the exam.
sentences.chinese: 这些都是供您阅读和练习才来考试的转述和引用。

sentences.english: She gave him a full account of her conversation with the doctor.
sentences.chinese: 她向他原原本本地转述了自己和医生的对话。

sentences.english: Listened to Amys retail, ChenYan blame Amy is god sent to torture her.
sentences.chinese: 听了艾米的转述，陈妍责备艾米是老天派来折磨她的。

sentences.english: I am merely reporting what he said.
Today, she informally represents the views of many of the former hostage-takers.
sentences.chinese: 今天，她简单转述了许多其他以前劫持者的观点。

sentences.english: Chapter One is a retrospection of the studies on speech reporting.
sentences.chinese: 第一章简单回顾了转述引语研究的历史。

sentences.english: However, linguists have seldom involved in the study of reporting verbs.
sentences.chinese: 但是，对引语中转述动词的研究却甚少有人涉及。

definition: to repeat (one's own words or sb else's)/(in the classroom) to paraphrase what one has learned
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
from beginning to end/in its entirety/in accord with fact/literal
lit. count by fives and tens (idiom); to narrate systematically and in full detail
lit. to add oil and vinegar/fig. adding details while telling a story (to make it more interesting)
see 一字不漏[yi1 zi4 bu4 lou4]
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
